qas.question: Who was the Prime Minister of South Africa in 1947?
What were the King's South African bodyguards referred as?
Who instructed the King to only shake hands with whites in South Africa?
In what year did Jan Smuts become Prime Minister?
Whose South African government instituted a strict policy of racial segregation?
What race were the South African bodyguards?
In what year did George become King?

context: In <b3_0><b6_0>1947<b6_0/><b3_0/>, the King and his family toured Southern Africa. The Prime Minister of the Union of South Africa, <a0_0><b4_0>Jan Smuts<b4_0/><a0_0/>, was facing an election and hoped to make political capital out of the visit. George was appalled, however, when instructed by the <a2_0>South African government<a2_0/> to shake hands only with <b5_0>whites<b5_0/>, and referred to his South African bodyguards as "<a1_0>the Gestapo<a1_0/>". Despite the tour, Smuts lost the election the following year, and the new government instituted a strict policy of racial segregation.
